The rapid evolution of technology is reshaping the way to produce, distribute and consume renewable energy. The ability of developing nations to adopt new technologies will determine their transition acceleration rate. Speaking ahead of the 13th Ghana Economic Forum (GEF) organised by the B&FT, he stressed that key to the National Energy Transition Framework is reliable and efficient adoption of new technologies which can drive the changeover from traditional fossil fuels to renewable energy sources. Prof. Gyamfi, an expert in energy efficiency and renewable energy, further underscored the pivotal role that harnessing the power of innovation and embracing cutting-edge technological solutions will play in expediting the shift toward a more sustainable and resilient energy system. ‚ÄúGlobally, about 84 percent of energy is from fossil fuels ‚Äì and that brings about high emissions leading to the climate change and environmental issues experienced today. Embracing technology is not just a choice; it‚Äôs a necessity in today‚Äôs energy landscape. title: The Rise of Solar Energy : Leading the Renewable Revolution
article_text: Renewable energy is produced from natural sources such as solar, hydropower, and wind. The huge potential of solar energy contributed to its huge rise. Solar Energy Leading the Renewable Shift Global installations of renewable energy grew by 50% in 2023, with three-quarters of this growth coming from solar energy. Solar energy‚Äôs remarkable growth highlights its pivotal role in the worldwide shift towards sustainable energy sources. A VPN provider has just recently delved into this topic and revealed how China has become the world leader in solar energy generation. In 2023, China installed more PV power plants than all other countries combined in the same year, and its solar energy output rose by an astounding 66% in just a single year. Solar energy is expanding rapidly outside of China. Governments are investing significantly in this renewable resource because of its numerous benefits. The United States, India, and Japan are also making huge progress in extending their solar energy capacities. Not only does solar energy lower carbon emissions, but it also has significant financial advantages. From the manufacturing of solar panels to their installation and maintenance, the industry creates plenty of jobs. The creation of jobs is essential for economic growth, especially in areas that are moving away from fossil fuels. Furthermore, the overall cost of solar energy has been steadily dropping over time. Thanks to technological advancements and larger manufacturing volumes, solar panels are now more reasonably priced than ever. Due to its lower cost, solar energy is now an affordable choice for a wider range of customers, including big businesses and individual homeowners. Why Solar Energy is Gaining Popularity? Several reasons include: Clean and Sustainable: Compared to fossil fuels, solar power is greener and leaves less carbon behind. Abundant Resource: The energy produced by the sun is infinite and could more than double the world‚Äôs energy requirements. Economic Benefits: Over time, solar projects reduce energy prices and generate jobs. Global Impact and Future Predictions Based on predictions, the world may rule out fossil fuels by 2050 and totally rely on renewable sources like solar power. That literally makes the shift to renewable energy essential. Benefits of Solar Energy Job Creation: There are many jobs associated with the solar industry, from manufacturing, and installation to maintenance. Reduced Energy Bills: Due to inflation and the rise in electricity prices, homeowners and businesses are more likely to save money on electricity bills with solar energy systems and ultimately offset the initial installation cost. Energy Independence: Countries may reduce their dependence on imported fossil fuels. Mitigating Climate Change: Solar power reduces greenhouse gas emissions and the carbon footprint of energy production. The Future of Solar Energy Solar panels are becoming more economical and efficient as technology develops. Smart grids and energy storage are two innovations that will aid in integrating solar power into the energy system. Governments are also providing incentives and policies to support renewable energy. First Solar , another prominent player in the solar energy market, emphasizes the advancements in thin-film solar technology. First Solar‚Äôs innovations have contributed to making solar panels lighter and more efficient, further driving down the costs and making solar energy accessible to a broader audience. Additionally, SunPower Corporation , known for its high-efficiency solar panels, has highlighted the importance of residential solar solutions in the renewable energy landscape. SunPower‚Äôs cutting-edge technology allows homeowners to maximize their energy production, contributing significantly to the overall growth of solar energy adoption. Conclusion Prospects for renewable energy are bright, given solar energy‚Äôs exponential growth. Solar power is expected to dominate global energy production, with nations such as China setting the example. This article is written by Fahad Khan. title: Energy storage capacity to see robust uptick
article_text: Energy storage capacity to see robust uptick By ZHENG XIN | China Daily | Updated: 2024-08-01 09:22 A driver charges his new energy vehicle in Chongqing. [SUN KAIFANG/FOR CHINA DAILY] Fueled by innovative technologies and rapid advances in the renewables sector, China's energy storage capacity is poised for significant growth, the National Energy Administration said on Wednesday. The country's power storage capacity has steadily increased this year, with over 44 million kilowatts already in operation by the end of June, up 40 percent year-on-year, the energy authority said during a news conference in Beijing. The government has been continuously advancing energy storage technologies, with several compressed air energy storage, flow battery storage, and sodium-ion battery storage projects put into operation across the nation, Bian Guangqi, an NEA official, said at the conference. New energy storage, or energy storage using new technologies such as lithium-ion batteries, liquid flow batteries, compressed air and mechanical energy, is an important foundation for building the country's new power system, which enjoys advantages such as quick response, flexible configuration and short construction timelines. According to Bian, new energy storage systems are playing a critical role in ensuring grid connection of renewable energy, with the equivalent utilization hours of new energy storage in the operating areas of State Grid Corp of China, the country's largest power utility, reaching 390 hours during the first half of 2024, approximately doubling from the first half of 2023. Meanwhile, figures for that of China Southern Power Grid's operating areas reached 560 hours, nearly matching the total utilization for 2023, he said. According to Deng Simeng, a senior analyst in renewables and power research at global consultancy Rystad Energy, battery storage is drawing significant attention due to its crucial role and benefits, which include smaller devices, flexible site requirements and shorter construction periods compared to wind, solar and other traditional power sources. As numerous gigawatt-scale renewable base projects come online in Northwest China, the local grid system must integrate this renewable capacity, optimize power output and manage the intermittency issues associated with wind and solar energy, said Deng. Given the rapid expansion of renewable installations, accelerating the development of new energy storage solutions will be a crucial breakthrough for the northwestern region. This will help mitigate renewable curtailment and ensure a more resilient and secure power grid, she added. According to the administration, the northern and northwestern parts of the country have seen the fastest development of new-type energy storage facilities, accounting for over 50 percent of the newly operational energy storage installations nationwide. In terms of application scenarios, independent energy storage and shared energy storage installations account for 45.3 percent, energy storage installations paired with new energy projects account for 42.8 percent, and other application scenarios account for 11.9 percent. The installed capacity of renewable energy has achieved fresh breakthroughs. In the first half of 2024, the nationwide newly installed capacity for renewable energy power generation reached 134 million kilowatts, a year-on-year increase of 24 percent, accounting for 88 percent of the total new power generation capacity in the country. The NEA issued a notice in April titled "Promotion of New Energy Storage Integration and Dispatch Utilization", aimed at standardizing the integration of new energy storage into the grid and promoting efficient dispatch utilization of new energy storage. The notice outlined specific requirements for grid enterprises, power dispatch agencies and new energy storage project units. The country has also been expanding the scale of charging facilities, with the total number of charging piles nationwide reaching 10.24 million as of the end of June, a year-on-year increase of 54 percent, including 3.12 million public charging piles and 7.12 million private ones. The total rated power of public charging piles exceeds 110 million kilowatts, meeting the charging needs of 24 million new energy vehicles, it said. In the first half of the year, the nationwide charging volume for new energy vehicles was around 51.3 billion kilowatt-hours, a year-on-year increase of 40 percent. Efforts are being made to address the charging infrastructure gap in rural areas, said Zhang Xing, a spokesman of the energy administration. "We have organized charging infrastructure construction and promotion activities in some counties and towns, and more than one-third of the provinces have extended charging facilities to all townships, strongly supporting the rural adoption of new energy vehicles," Zhang said. Associated press file photo Facebook Twitter WhatsApp SMS Email Print Copy article link Save For more than a century, Louisiana has been an energy-rich state and a world leader in energy exploration, production and innovation. We have achieved this success thanks to our state‚Äôs abundant natural resources, highly skilled workforce unmatched anywhere else in the world and extensive network of pipelines that supply half America‚Äôs refining capacity. As we look to Louisiana‚Äôs future, the energy industry‚Äôs emerging expansion represents a golden opportunity for us to grow our economy in ways not seen since Louisiana‚Äôs first oil boom. The numbers speak volumes: Louisiana's energy sector sustains over 346,000 jobs, contributes $25 billion in wages and generates $54 billion in economic output. Our state provides direct access to America‚Äôs only deepwater offshore oil port, produces clean offshore energy supplies for our nation and allies and is home to some of the world‚Äôs largest liquefied natural gas export terminals. Marc Ehrhardt Provided photo Today, Louisiana‚Äôs robust energy infrastructure and experienced workforce remain an essential national resource, strengthening our state‚Äôs economy and supplying both America‚Äôs energy needs and global market demands. Right now, America‚Äôs energy sector is expanding as the demand for all types of energy production keeps growing. Louisiana is working to fulfill this demand and capitalize on the energy industry‚Äôs expansion. Energy producers around the world, like ExxonMobil, Shell, Chevron and dozens of others are investing billions of dollars into Louisiana‚Äôs working energy infrastructure. This includes: $50 billion in new project investment for energy production, manufacturing or related facilities according to Louisiana Economic Development More than $20 billion in clean hydrogen energy production projects with more than 10,000 future job opportunities A $27.5 million investment from Shell that will create the LSU Institute for Energy Innovation to study and direct the future of American energy $46.9 billion for six energy-related projects planned at the Calcasieu Ship Channel $3.6 million from ExxonMobil to lead innovation around future energy projects and educational programs teaching Louisiana students about new technologies such as advanced recycling, carbon capture and clean hydrogen. Tommy Faucheux Provided photo Louisiana can do more if we embrace our position as the leading energy innovation state in America. For example, Louisiana could gain up to $13 billion in private investments plus thousands of new jobs for carbon management and hydrogen energy production. Additionally, one offshore wind farm in the Gulf of Mexico could support 4,400 new jobs and $445 million in new investment. The need for oil and natural gas resources is not going away. By supporting our oil and natural gas investments and new opportunities in energy advancements, Louisiana can lead America‚Äôs energy expansion and be at the forefront of the great American energy renaissance. Let‚Äôs build on our ability to supply the world‚Äôs energy needs by producing even more energy through innovations like hydrogen and offshore wind. Mike Moncla Provided photo This isn't about replacing our traditional energy efforts. It's about enhancing them, while embracing innovation and preparing for the growing global energy demand. We know what the energy industry gives to Louisiana ‚Äî a robust economy contributing more funding for local schools, police protection and coastal restoration plus an exciting future brimming with in-state, advanced careers. Industry leaders, energy advocates, scientists and local communities are backing the future of Louisiana energy by working together across our state, advocating for pro-energy policies and streamlining regulations to ensure that Louisiana remains at the forefront of energy production. It is vital that we remain firm in our support of Louisiana‚Äôs energy expansion for the people of the industry. Our action or inaction today will determine whether Louisiana‚Äôs position as a premier energy-producing state will be preserved or threatened. Let us stand united and resolve to do what it takes to not only maintain but fortify Louisiana's exceptional energy culture and way of life, now and well into the future. Marc Ehrhardt is the executive director of Grow Louisiana Coalition. Tommy Faucheux is the president of Louisiana Mid-Continent Oil and Gas Association. title: Renewable energy budget increased to over ¬£1 . 5bn as record funding allocated for clean power
article_text: The UK‚Äôs renewable energy budget has been increased to a record ¬£1.5 billion, Ed Miliband announced on Wednesday. Of that, ¬£1.1 billion will be allocated for offshore wind , which the government described as ‚Äúthe backbone of the UK‚Äôs clean energy mission‚Äù. The funding uplift represents more than a 50 per cent increase on the budget previously set in March. The renewable energy industry will bid for the sum in order to deliver clean energy projects in the UK. The Department for Energy Security and Net Zero said the higher budget will ‚Äúboost energy security, secure cheap power for families, and unlock economic growth and jobs for the country‚Äù. It will ‚Äúaccelerate the delivery of clean, cheap, low-carbon electricity to families and businesses, generated by renewable energy technologies such as wind turbines and solar panels‚Äù, the department added. open image in gallery ( James Glossop/The Times/PA Wire ) Firms in the renewables industry will bid for a share of the funding through the government‚Äôs sixth renewable auction ‚Äì known as the Contracts for Difference scheme ‚Äì which provides developers with initial subsidies for clean electricity projects across Britain. Contracts for Difference works by developers bidding for contracts to help deliver renewable energy projects, with the scheme providing a guaranteed price for the clean electricity they generate. The Department for Energy Security and Net Zero said the scheme gives industry greater certainty to invest, knowing that when electricity prices fluctuate, they will always get a set price for their projects. Meanwhile, Mr Miliband said it demonstrates that Labour is ‚Äúbacking industry to build in Britain‚Äù. title: Is energy a real thing , or did scientists just make it up ?
article_text: Published July 30th, 2024 - 04:37 GMT Shutterstock ALBAWABA Energy is a fundamental concept in both everyday life and scientific understanding. It‚Äôs what powers our homes, fuels our cars, and even keeps our bodies functioning. But what exactly is energy? Is it a tangible entity, or is it a construct created by scientists to explain natural phenomena? Also Read How to tell if your mayonnaise has gone bad in summer Let's delve into the nature of energy to understand its reality and significance. Understanding Energy Definition of Energy : In physics, energy is defined as the ability to do work. It is a measure of the capacity to cause change or perform actions. This can include anything from moving an object to generating heat or light. Types of Energy Kinetic Energy : The energy of motion. Anything that is moving has kinetic energy. Potential Energy : Stored energy that depends on the position or configuration of an object. For example, a rock held at a height has gravitational potential energy. Thermal Energy : The energy associated with the temperature of an object. Chemical Energy : Stored in the bonds of chemical compounds, like in food or batteries. Electrical Energy : Associated with electric charges and their movement. Nuclear Energy : Stored in the nucleus of atoms and released through nuclear reactions. Radiant Energy : Energy carried by light and electromagnetic waves. The Reality of Energy Observable Effects : While energy itself may not be directly observable in the same way as a physical object, its effects are very real and measurable. For instance, when you kick a soccer ball, the energy from your leg is transferred to the ball, causing it to move. Conservation of Energy : One of the fundamental principles of physics is the conservation of energy, which states that energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed from one form to another. This principle has been confirmed through countless experiments and is a cornerstone of modern science. Measurement of Energy : Energy can be measured in various units, such as joules, calories, and kilowatt-hours. These measurements allow scientists and engineers to quantify energy in practical applications, from calculating the fuel efficiency of cars to determining the power consumption of electronic devices. Energy in Everyday Life Electricity : Powers our homes, devices, and industries. Food : Provides the chemical energy our bodies need to function. Transportation : Fuel in vehicles is converted into kinetic energy to move us from place to place. Theoretical and Practical Implications Scientific Models : The concept of energy is integral to many scientific models and theories, including thermodynamics, quantum mechanics, and relativity. These models help scientists predict and explain a wide range of phenomena, from the behavior of subatomic particles to the expansion of the universe. Technological Advances : Understanding and harnessing energy has led to significant technological advancements. Innovations in renewable energy sources like solar and wind power are transforming how we generate and consume energy, addressing global challenges like climate change. title: Commending John Dramani Mahama on his promise to establish a renewable energy commission
article_text: Elikplim Apetorgbor Audio By Carbonatix In a commendable move towards a sustainable energy future, John Dramani Mahama, the flagbearer of the National Democratic Congress (NDC), has pledged to establish a Renewable Energy Commission. This strategic and deep thought initiative underscores his commitment to addressing Ghana's energy challenges by integrating renewable energy resources into the national energy mix. There are significant benefits of setting up a Renewable Energy Commission, and successful international references, worth mentioning. A Visionary Step Towards Energy Competitiveness and Security Ghana's energy sector has faced numerous challenges, including inconsistent power supply and reliance on fossil fuels. Establishing a Renewable Energy Commission represents a forward-thinking solution to these issues. By focusing on renewable energy, Ghana can diversify its energy sources, reduce dependence on fuels, and enhance energy security. Key Benefits of a Renewable Energy Commission 1. Promotion of Sustainable Development: A Renewable Energy Commission will play a crucial role in promoting sustainable development by harnessing Ghana's abundant renewable resources, such as solar, wind, and hydropower. This will reduce the environmental impact of energy production and contribute to global climate change mitigation efforts. 2. Economic Growth and Job Creation: The renewable energy sector has the potential to drive economic growth and create numerous job opportunities. From manufacturing and installation to maintenance and research, the industry can provide employment across various skill levels, contributing to national economic development. 3. Reduction in Energy Costs: Renewable energy technologies have seen significant cost reductions over the past decade. By investing in renewables, Ghana can reduce energy costs in the long term, making electricity more affordable for consumers and businesses. 4. Energy Independence: Developing renewable energy resources will reduce Ghana's dependence on fossil fuels. This energy independence will insulate the country from volatile global fuel prices and enhance national security. 5. Technological Innovation: A Renewable Energy Commission will foster technological innovation by supporting research and development in renewable energy technologies. This will position Ghana as a leader in the region and encourage local expertise and innovation. International Success Stories Several countries have successfully implemented renewable energy commissions or similar bodies, leading to significant advancements in their energy sectors. 1. Germany: Germany's Renewable Energy Act and the establishment of the German Renewable Energy Agency have been instrumental in the country's transition to renewable energy. Today, Germany is a global leader in solar and wind energy, with renewables accounting for a substantial share of its energy mix. 2. Denmark: Denmark's commitment to renewable energy is exemplified by its Danish Energy Agency. The country's focus on wind energy has made it a world leader, with wind power meeting over 40% of its electricity demand. 3. South Africa: The South African Renewable Energy Independent Power Producer Procurement Programme (REIPPPP) has attracted significant investment in renewable energy, leading to the successful deployment of solar and wind projects. This program has created jobs, stimulated economic growth, and increased energy security. John Dramani Mahama's promise to establish a Renewable Energy Commission is a visionary and strategic step towards ensuring Ghana's energy competitiveness and security. By leveraging the country's renewable energy resources, Ghana can achieve sustainable development, economic growth, and energy independence. The successful experiences of Germany, Denmark, and South Africa provide valuable lessons and highlight the transformative potential of renewable energy. This initiative deserves commendation and full support as Ghana moves towards a brighter, greener future. Harnessing solar energy for sustainable agriculture: Innovations and benefits Solar energy not only offers a sustainable solution to the energy demands of agriculture but also presents numerous innovative applications that can revolutionise the industry By Swati Singh Updated - July 28, 2024 at 09:30 AM. √ó Share WhatsApp X Facebook LinkedIn Messenger Reddit Mail https://www.thehindubusinessline.com/economy/agri-business/harnessing-solar-energy-for-sustainable-agriculture-innovations-and-benefits/article68453736.ece Copy In recent years, the intersection of agriculture and renewable energy has become a focal point for fostering sustainable development. Among the various renewable energy sources, solar energy stands out due to its abundant availability and potential for integration into farming practices. Solar energy not only offers a sustainable solution to the energy demands of agriculture but also presents numerous innovative applications that can revolutionise the industry. This article explores the innovations and benefits of harnessing solar energy for sustainable agriculture. Innovations in agriculture -Solar-Powered Irrigation Systems Traditional irrigation systems, often reliant on diesel or electricity, can be costly and environmentally damaging. Solar-powered irrigation systems provide a sustainable alternative. These systems use photovoltaic (PV) panels to convert sunlight into electricity, which powers water pumps. This innovation is particularly beneficial in regions with limited access to reliable electricity. Solar irrigation reduces fuel costs and greenhouse gas emissions, promoting environmentally friendly farming. Agrovoltaics Agrovoltaics is an innovative approach where solar panels are installed above crops. This dual-use of land allows for the simultaneous production of food and electricity. The shade provided by the panels can reduce water evaporation and protect crops from extreme weather conditions. Additionally, the electricity generated can be used on the farm or sold to the grid, providing an additional income stream for farmers. Studies have shown that agrovoltaic systems can increase land productivity by combining agriculture and energy production. Solar Greenhouses Solar greenhouses incorporate PV panels into their design, enabling them to generate their electricity. This electricity can be used to power heating, cooling, and lighting systems within the greenhouse, creating an optimal growing environment for plants year-round. By reducing the reliance on external energy sources, solar greenhouses contribute to the sustainability and profitability of agricultural operations. Solar-Powered Cold Storage Post-harvest losses due to inadequate storage facilities are a significant challenge in agriculture, especially in developing countries. Solar-powered cold storage units offer a solution by providing a reliable and sustainable means of preserving perishable produce. These units use solar energy to maintain low temperatures, extending the shelf life of fruits, vegetables, and other agricultural products. This innovation helps reduce food waste and ensures that farmers can store their produce until market conditions are favourable. Benefits of solar energy in agriculture Cost savings : One of the most significant benefits of solar energy in agriculture is cost savings. By replacing conventional energy sources with solar power, farmers can significantly reduce their energy expenses. Solar panels have a long lifespan and require minimal maintenance, providing a cost-effective energy solution in the long run. The initial investment in solar technology is often offset by the savings on energy bills and potential income from selling excess electricity. Environmental sustainability : Solar energy is a clean and renewable resource that produces no greenhouse gas emissions during operation. By integrating solar energy into agricultural practices, farmers can reduce their carbon footprint and contribute to environmental sustainability. This shift towards renewable energy helps combat climate change and promotes the conservation of natural resources. Energy Independence: Relying on solar energy provides farmers with greater energy independence. In remote or off-grid areas, access to electricity can be unreliable and expensive. Solar energy systems enable farmers to generate their own power, reducing their dependence on external energy providers. This energy independence enhances the resilience of agricultural operations and ensures a more stable and predictable energy supply. Enhanced Productivity: Innovations such as agrovoltaics and solar greenhouses can enhance agricultural productivity. Agrovoltaic systems allow for the dual use of land, increasing overall land productivity. Solar greenhouses create optimal growing conditions, enabling year-round cultivation and higher crop yields. By improving productivity, solar energy can help meet the growing demand for food and support the economic viability of farming. Conclusion Harnessing solar energy for sustainable agriculture presents a promising pathway towards a more resilient and environmentally friendly agricultural sector. Innovations like solar-powered irrigation, agrovoltaics, solar greenhouses, and solar-powered cold storage demonstrate the potential of solar energy to transform farming practices. The benefits of cost savings, environmental sustainability, energy independence, and enhanced productivity underscore the value of integrating solar energy into agriculture. As the world continues to grapple with the challenges of climate change and food security, solar energy offers a sustainable solution that can help secure the future of agriculture. To date, SUNO has received $311,700 in incentives from Energy Smart to complete six energy efficiency upgrades that include HVAC replacement and installing building automation systems and LED lighting upgrades. The upgrades were funded entirely with Energy Smart program incentives. "' Entergy New Orleans is proud to partner with Southern University at New Orleans in their efforts to become more energy efficient," said Deanna Rodriguez, president and CEO, Entergy New Orleans. "The funding provided to SUNO through the Energy Smart program not only helps cover the costs of their energy efficiency upgrades, but also supports SUNO in accomplishing its broader sustainability goals." SUNO is committed to making its campus more energy efficient and sustainable and plans to complete four additional projects scheduled for July completion. The estimated cash incentives for future projects are $69,000. In addition to the funds received to help cover the total project costs, SUNO anticipates significant reductions in energy bills and fewer maintenance requests in the future. Ammons, Jr., chancellor, Southern University at New Orleans. Energy Smart offers incentives to Entergy New Orleans business customers to implement energy-saving upgrades in their businesses and facilities. Helping customers become energy efficient and sustainable aligns with Entergy New Orleans' commitment to reducing energy consumption in Orleans Parish. title: Energy Management : The Use Of Wasted Energy For AI Computing
article_text: Innovation Energy Management: The Use Of Wasted Energy For AI Computing By Adrien Nejkovic , Former Forbes Councils Member. for Forbes Technology Council COUNCIL POST Expertise from Forbes Councils members, operated under license. Opinions expressed are those of the author. | Membership (fee-based) Jul 17, 2024, 10:00am EDT Share Save Adrien Nejkovic is CEO at Hearst Capital : Pioneering sustainable tech & finance with AI, blockchain and renewable energy. getty As the world becomes increasingly digital, the demand for computing power has skyrocketed . Technologies such as artificial intelligence (AI) and blockchain have emerged as transformative forces but also have significant energy requirements. As an entrepreneur deeply involved in the tech industry, I have had the unique opportunity to negotiate and implement the use of wasted energy for AI computing and blockchain mining. This experience has not only opened my eyes to the immense potential of this approach but has also convinced me that it represents the future of energy management. The Challenge Of Energy Consumption AI computing and blockchain mining are notoriously energy-intensive processes. AI algorithms require substantial computational power to train and operate, while blockchain mining involves solving complex mathematical problems, necessitating vast amounts of electricity. Traditionally, this has led to significant environmental concerns, with critics pointing out the substantial carbon footprint associated with these technologies. However, the growing emphasis on sustainability has spurred the search for more efficient and eco-friendly energy solutions . This is where the concept of utilizing wasted energy comes into play. Wasted energy refers to the excess energy produced by industrial processes or renewable energy sources that would otherwise go unused. By redirecting this energy towards AI computing and blockchain mining, we can significantly reduce the environmental impact of these technologies. My Journey Into Wasted Energy Utilization My journey into this innovative approach began while exploring ways to optimize energy use in our AI-driven projects. I realized that a significant amount of energy generated by various industrial processes was being wasted, so I investigated how we could harness this excess energy for our computational needs. The first step was to identify potential sources of wasted energy. We focused on industries known for high energy consumption and significant waste, such as manufacturing and power generation. Partnering with these industries required extensive negotiations. We needed to demonstrate the mutual benefits of redirecting their wasted energy to our operations. This involved detailed presentations on how this approach could enhance their sustainability efforts, improve their corporate social responsibility profiles and potentially offer financial incentives through energy credits or reduced operational costs. The Negotiation Process Negotiating these partnerships was no small feat. It required a deep understanding of both the industrial and technological landscapes. One key challenge was convincing industry stakeholders of the feasibility and reliability of using their wasted energy for our purposes. Many were initially skeptical and concerned about the stability of the energy supply and the technical challenges in transferring energy from their processes to our computing facilities. To address these concerns, we conducted pilot projects demonstrating this approach and the benefits of practical applications. We partnered with several manufacturing plants that produced significant waste heat. By installing heat recovery systems, we will convert this heat into electricity, which will then be used to power our AI data centers. The success of this study provided a compelling proof of concept, which helped gain the trust and cooperation of other industry partners. The Benefits Of Wasted Energy Utilization The benefits of utilizing wasted energy for AI computing and blockchain mining are manifold. Firstly, it significantly reduces the carbon footprint associated with these technologies. By tapping into energy that would otherwise go unused, we minimize the demand for additional power generation, which often relies on fossil fuels. Secondly, this approach enhances the overall efficiency of energy use. Industrial processes become more sustainable as their energy waste is repurposed productively. This not only supports environmental goals but also offers economic benefits. Industries can lower their energy costs and earn incentives for contributing to sustainable energy practices. Moreover, using wasted energy can lead to more resilient and decentralized energy systems. Instead of relying solely on traditional power grids, which can be vulnerable to disruptions, AI and blockchain operations can benefit from multiple, diverse energy sources. This diversification enhances the stability and reliability of the energy supply for these critical technologies. The Future Of Energy Management The successful integration of wasted energy utilization into AI computing and blockchain mining represents a significant step forward in energy management . As the demand for computational power continues to grow, finding sustainable energy solutions becomes imperative. My experience has shown that we can turn potential environmental liabilities into assets with the right approach and partnerships. Looking ahead, I believe this model can be scaled and applied globally. Governments and regulatory bodies can play a crucial role by creating policies and incentives that encourage wasted energy use. For instance, offering tax breaks or subsidies for companies that implement energy recovery systems can accelerate the adoption of this practice. Furthermore, technological advancements will continue to improve the efficiency and feasibility of energy recovery and utilization. Innovations in energy storage, grid integration and heat recovery systems will enhance our ability to effectively capture and repurpose wasted energy. Conclusion My journey into negotiating the use of wasted energy for AI computing and blockchain mining has been enlightening and rewarding. This approach not only addresses the energy challenges associated with these technologies but also paves the way for more sustainable and efficient energy management practices. By harnessing wasted energy, we can support the growth of AI and blockchain in an environmentally responsible manner, contributing to a more sustainable future. As we move forward, it is essential for industry stakeholders, policymakers and technologists to collaborate and explore innovative solutions like this. The future of energy management lies in our ability to adapt and optimize our resources. Utilizing wasted energy is a powerful example of how we can turn challenges into opportunities, ensuring our technological advancements align with our environmental responsibilities. title: Pakistan power crisis
article_text: Latest News National Sports World Business Entertainment Royal Videos Hollywood Technology Health Trending Today's Paper Opinion Writer's Archive Magazines TNS Instep Money Matters YOU US Pakistan‚Äôs power crisis In October 2023, Pakistan had an energy deficit of 6,000MW, incurring an import bill of $7 billion By Simra Sohail July 17, 2024 A bulb can be seen in this image. ‚Äî AFP/File Pakistan has been grappling with a severe energy crisis for several years. Energy demand continues to soar while the supply of conventional energy sources remains inadequate. This imbalance has resulted in frequent power outages, which not only hinder economic growth and disrupt daily life but also impede technological advancement. As the gap between energy supply and demand widens, the nation faces escalating power costs and increasing reliance on imports. In October 2023, Pakistan had an energy deficit of 6,000MW, incurring an import bill of $7 billion. According to the National Electric Power Regulatory Authority‚Äôs (Nepra) 2022 annual report, Pakistan‚Äôs installed generation capacity adds up to 43,775 MW, of which merely 7.0 per cent comes from renewable energy sources. Addressing this crisis requires strategic investments in renewable energy infrastructure and policy reforms to ensure a sustainable energy supply for Pakistan‚Äôs future. The origins of Pakistan‚Äôs energy crisis can be traced back to the 1970s when Pakistan narrowly averted a major energy crisis when the government launched the Mangla and Tarbela dams. These projects ushered in a brief era of robust hydro-driven energy generation that effectively met the country‚Äôs demands. However, the 1980s saw a period of strong economic growth that caused energy demand to surge. Despite government efforts to increase generation, they failed to keep up with the escalating demand. The energy crisis in Pakistan stems from a multitude of interconnected and overlapping factors. Pakistan‚Äôs energy crisis is primarily driven by its heavy reliance on non-renewable and expensive fossil fuels, which make up 59 per cent of the energy mix. This dependence is exacerbated by outdated transmission lines, infrastructural flaws, and issues such as line losses, power theft, and inefficient energy usage. The country‚Äôs energy infrastructure is further strained by overpopulation, rapid urbanization, and industrialization. A World Bank report projects that Pakistan‚Äôs energy demand will increase by 70 per cent by 2030, while supply is expected to grow by only 45 per cent. Economic instability and a shortage of technical expertise compound these challenges. Additionally, systemic corruption and inefficiencies within generation and distribution companies (Gencos and DISCOs) significantly contribute to the crisis. The lack of consistent political will and effective energy policies, coupled with shortsighted commitments to independent power producers (IPPs) and the burden of circular debt, perpetuate Pakistan‚Äôs enduring energy challenges. To address Pakistan‚Äôs energy crisis, a multifaceted approach is urgently needed. The country must diversify its energy mix by investing heavily in renewable energy sources such as solar, wind, and hydropower. Given that only a paltry 7.0 per cent of Pakistan‚Äôs energy currently comes from renewable sources, significantly increasing this share is important. This transition not only reduces dependency on costly fossil fuel but also aligns with global trends towards sustainable energy. Additionally, expanding and upgrading the transmission infrastructure is vital to mitigate the chronic issues of line losses and power theft, which have long plagued the system. Modernizing these outdated transmission lines will enhance efficiency and reliability, ensuring that generated power reaches consumers. Addressing systemic corruption and inefficiencies within the generation and distribution companies (Gencos and DISCOs) is paramount. The government must implement stringent anti-corruption measures and overhaul management practices to eliminate waste and financial mismanagement. This should be coupled with a consistent political will to enforce these reforms and hold accountable those who fail to comply. Revisiting and renegotiating short-sighted agreements with IPPs can alleviate some of the financial burdens contributing to circular debt. Such measures would restore financial stability to the power sector. Additionally, the bureaucratic red tape that hinders project implementation must be streamlined to avoid delays and inflated costs, ensuring that projects are completed on time and within budget. Enhancing local technical expertise is critical for sustainable energy development. Investing in education and training programmes for engineers and technicians will build a skilled workforce capable of maintaining and advancing the energy infrastructure. This long-term investment is necessary to keep pace with technological advancements and ensure the efficient operation of energy systems. Public-private partnerships can attract investment and innovation, leveraging the private sector‚Äôs efficiencies and expertise to bolster the public energy sector. Utilizing untapped and renewable energy sources with high potential and capacity -- wind (50,000 MW), solar (40,000 MW), hydro (40,000 MW), and Thar coal (100,000 MW) -- alongside tidal, biofuels, and nuclear potential, would be a great stride in this regard. By harnessing these resources, Pakistan can bolster its energy supply and reduce reliance on imported fossil fuels. The government must also prioritize energy conservation and efficiency measures. Implementing policies that encourage the use of energy-efficient appliances and practices can reduce overall demand. Public awareness campaigns should highlight the importance of energy conservation and the economic benefits it can bring to the country. These efforts, combined with structural reforms, can help bridge the projected gap between energy supply and demand, ensuring a stable and sustainable energy future for Pakistan. Britannica Editors Last updated Oct. 10, 2025 ‚Ä¢ History Britannica AI Ask Anything Table of Contents Table of Contents Ask Anything potential energy , stored energy that depends upon the relative position of various parts of a system. A spring has more potential energy when it is compressed or stretched. A steel ball has more potential energy raised above the ground than it has after falling to Earth . In the raised position it is capable of doing more work . Potential energy is a property of a system and not of an individual body or particle; the system composed of Earth and the raised ball, for example, has more potential energy as the two are farther separated. Potential energy arises in systems with parts that exert forces on each other of a magnitude dependent on the configuration, or relative position, of the parts. In the case of the Earth-ball system, the force of gravity between the two depends only on the distance separating them. The work done in separating them farther, or in raising the ball, transfers additional energy to the system, where it is stored as gravitational potential energy. (more) See all videos for this article Potential energy also includes other forms. The energy stored between the plates of a charged capacitor is electrical potential energy. What is commonly known as chemical energy , the capacity of a substance to do work or to evolve heat by undergoing a change of composition , may be regarded as potential energy resulting from the mutual forces among its molecules and atoms . Nuclear energy is also a form of potential energy. Britannica Quiz 27 True-or-False Questions from Britannica‚Äôs Most Difficult Science Quizzes The potential energy of a system of particles depends only on their initial and final configurations; it is independent of the path the particles travel. In the case of the steel ball and Earth, if the initial position of the ball is ground level and the final position is 10 feet above the ground, the potential energy is the same, no matter how or by what route the ball was raised. The value of potential energy is arbitrary and relative to the choice of reference point. In the case given above, the system would have twice as much potential energy if the initial position were the bottom of a 10-foot-deep hole. Gravitational potential energy near Earth‚Äôs surface may be computed by multiplying the weight of an object by its distance above the reference point. In bound systems, such as atoms, in which electrons are held by the electric force of attraction to nuclei, the zero reference for potential energy is a distance from the nucleus so great that the electric force is not detectable. In this case, bound electrons have negative potential energy, and those very far away have zero potential energy. Potential energy may be converted into energy of motion , called kinetic energy , and in turn to other forms such as electric energy. Thus, water behind a dam flows to lower levels through turbines that turn electric generators, producing electric energy plus some unusable heat energy resulting from turbulence and friction .
